column4: arreniex : i am using ubuntu at home and i dont have internet at home how can i install Xmms media player
it's not on the install cd?
:no its not on install cd
use apt-get to calculate dependencies for xmms. then download the binaries for xmms and any dependencies, put it on a medium and then to the other comp where you can install it.
: from where i can download xmms binaries
the binary is just the .deb file that ubuntu downloads when it installs it. are you on an ubuntu system now, or no?
: yes

apt-get install xmms. then "locate xmms | grep deb" to find the deb for it. and i forget the command to just calculate dependencies for apt-get.. "man apt-get" to see what it is. i'm not on ubuntu right now or id check for oyu.
: thanks
: all xmms deb file are reuired to copy and paste on other comp
what?
there should be an xmms bin in this folder: /var/cache/apt/archives/
there are two deb files
pastebin your "locate xmms | grep .deb" for me.
when i say "pastebin" i mean paste it on the paste website so we don't flood the channel. but anyways.
the i386 package should work
: what i386 packages
the xmms filename with i386 at the end
: locate xmms | grep deb then result come with two deb files in /var/cache/apt/archives
yeah dude i know, i said..  [00:03]  <kameron> rajshekhar: the xmms filename with i386 at the end
: yeah xmms ends with i386.deb
you were asking what package to use. i'm telling you, use the one that ends in i386. the other one ends in "all".
: thanks
